data.title: Tiberian Sun MIX file support
data.body: Won't crash, but OpenRA can't find anything in it. Tried VQA (format differs, too #3226) and AUD files (works when manually extracted).

data.title: Singleplayer game remains paused when opening/closing menu quickly

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Repro case:
- Start a game with no other clients
- Open the menu
- Close the menu and then immediately open it again by double-tapping escape
- Close the menu, and the game remains paused.

This happens because the non-zero order lag means that the unpause order hasn't been processed by the second menu opening, so the menu code thinks that it was a user-initiated pause and doesn't unpause when closing the menu.

The simplest fix would be to track the state locally as well as via orders, and use the local copy for deciding what to do on menu close.

data.title: Tileset ID is redundant
data.body:
As in chrome yaml the ID could get read from behind the `@`.

data.title: AI basebuilder needs a cleanup
data.body: It is far too complicated/redundant and hard to fix bugs in it. Some functions and variables seem to be labeled wrong or at least in a confusing manner.

data.title: Remove sequence warnings for the stable release.
data.body: As discussed in #3201 - a temporary fix for #3142 until we can fix the sequence loading mess properly.

data.title: Remove server pinging
data.body: We've now been through a pile of iterations of the server ping implementation, and it's still not working nicely. This removes it for the stable release.

milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: fixes #3198 by catching the null references completely

data.title: D2K / C&C updates
data.body: This is a fixed rebase/merge of @psydev's #3184 and #3205.

data.title: Actors reveal shroud at 0,0 when first produced

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
- Modify a unit to have large sight radius (20 works well).
- Build it ingame.

The actor is probably being added to the world before its initial position has been set.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: ...e map Nishnekolymsk

data.title: make map-reveal crate disable fog for 5-10 seconds instead of just revealing terrain
data.body:
Suggestion: make map-reveal crate disable fog for 5-10 seconds instead of just revealing terrain.
This makes the crate useful. Some games already start with the map revealed, and once you have most of it explored, the crate is not very useful, but having a glimpse of your opponent's units and getting an updated on their base building is a good thing to have.

data.title: buildings should be upgradable
data.body:
In the original Dune 2000, you could "upgrade barracks" or "ugprade construction yard". This costs money, and lets you build new units. 
In the original game, you could click on this from your build palette. 
There could be a function where an actor transforms, but costs money in order to do so.

data.title: Spectators with team talk and team world view
data.body:
It would be cool if the specs could lock to give comments to one side, and only view the world for one team...

Codders brought his office to play this, and I should have been able to help one team..

data.title: Log unhandled exceptions

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: It seems some recent-ish additions (to the map chooser?) have been causing the game to crash without creating a log. This will ensure a log is always created.

data.title: Fix mix header decryption.
data.body: Fixes #2176 and adds better logging for #2441 if it doesn't outright fix it.

data.title: bibs are visible under fog
data.body: When buildings are hidden under fog (until you explore them), the bibs appear on the map, thus giving away the location of the building before you explore it.

data.title: Dune 2000 visuals fix & additions
data.body:
Changes:
-Reverted to RA's explosion graphics, until translucence for explosions is added to the engine.

Added: 
-Devastator's original gun (2 plasma-looking bolts)
-One of the D2K explosions (bigboom) which looks good. Added to artillery.

data.title: custom hotkeys should override menu hotkeys
data.body:
If a user selects custom keys for sell/powerdown/repair, they should override the build menu hotkeys.

The same should apply to the key that centers you on your construction yard, and maybe others.

---

data.title: Removed some non-sense from the Red Alert AI configuration

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
- building >1 production buildings is bogus as it has no benefit (there is no speedup or anything, it is just waste of cash)
- changed all bot names to generic ones that describe the build order not fake personality (they all use the same algorithms and can be used for both factions)

data.title: Removed Mud track from RA playlist because crash reports came in
data.body: Reverted #2562 because #2176 was never fixed. It just seems to crash slightly randomly making the problem hard to track down.

data.title: Silenced missing files console warnings

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body: Fixes #3142 for RA and C&C. Now all shipped mods are clear of sprite not found exceptions.

data.title: Forbid specific player names
data.body:
Some player names should not be allowed to use:
Open
Closed
Hard AI
etc...

data.title: Status Infos as chat ("Connection lost")
data.body:
If a player leaves the game, chat window writes "Connection dropped". Thats not good, because it looks like chat, so the player can fake that he left the game by just typing exactly the same. 
It should be in another color/bold/or like the cheats: something like debug ....
Or passive: "NAME has left the game." Like the new welcome massage ("Press RETURN key to open chat window").
